trans-unit.source: How to Scale a Web App in an App Service Environment
trans-unit.target: How to Scale a Web App in an App Service Environment

trans-unit.source: Scaling a web app in an App Service Environment
trans-unit.target: Scaling a web app in an App Service Environment

trans-unit.source: At a high level, App Service Environments are essentially personal deployments of the Azure App Service into your VNET and only manageable by your subscription.
trans-unit.target: At a high level, App Service Environments are essentially personal deployments of the Azure App Service into your VNET and only manageable by your subscription.

trans-unit.source: They offer new networking capabilities because they are in your VNET and can also be scaled beyond what is normally available in the Azure App Service environments.
trans-unit.target: They offer new networking capabilities because they are in your VNET and can also be scaled beyond what is normally available in the Azure App Service environments.

trans-unit.source: If you need more information around what an App Service Environment(ASE) is then see <linkText>What is an App Service Environment[whatisase]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you need more information around what an App Service Environment(ASE) is then see <linkText>What is an App Service Environment[whatisase]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For details around creating an App Service Environment or creating a web app in an App Service Environment see <linkText>How to Create an App Service Environment[howtocreatease]</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>How to create a web app in an App Service Environment[createwebappinase]</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For details around creating an App Service Environment or creating a web app in an App Service Environment see <linkText>How to Create an App Service Environment[howtocreatease]</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>How to create a web app in an App Service Environment[createwebappinase]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: As a quick reminder, when you normally change a scale attribute for a web app, you are changing that at an App Service Plan level.
trans-unit.target: As a quick reminder, when you normally change a scale attribute for a web app, you are changing that at an App Service Plan level.

trans-unit.source: For details around scaling App Service Plans or just for details on App Service Plans outside of the App Service Environments see <linkText>Scale a web app in Azure App Service[scalewebapp]</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>App Service Plans in depth overview[appserviceplans]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For details around scaling App Service Plans or just for details on App Service Plans outside of the App Service Environments see <linkText>Scale a web app in Azure App Service[scalewebapp]</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>App Service Plans in depth overview[appserviceplans]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Scaling a web app in an App Service Environment is very similar to scaling web apps normally.
trans-unit.target: Scaling a web app in an App Service Environment is very similar to scaling web apps normally.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure App Service there are normally three things you can scale:
trans-unit.target: In the Azure App Service there are normally three things you can scale:

trans-unit.source: pricing plan
trans-unit.target: pricing plan

trans-unit.source: worker size (for dedicated instances)
trans-unit.target: worker size (for dedicated instances)

trans-unit.source: number of instances.
trans-unit.target: number of instances.

trans-unit.source: In an ASE there is no need to select or change the pricing plan.
trans-unit.target: In an ASE there is no need to select or change the pricing plan.

trans-unit.source: In terms of capabilities it is already at a Premium pricing capability level.
trans-unit.target: In terms of capabilities it is already at a Premium pricing capability level.

trans-unit.source: In an App Service Environment there are also no shared workers.
trans-unit.target: In an App Service Environment there are also no shared workers.

trans-unit.source: They are all dedicated workers.
trans-unit.target: They are all dedicated workers.

trans-unit.source: Instead of fixed sizes, the ASE admin can assign the size of the compute resource to be used for each worker pool.
trans-unit.target: Instead of fixed sizes, the ASE admin can assign the size of the compute resource to be used for each worker pool.

trans-unit.source: That means you can have Worker Pool 1 with P4 compute resources and Worker Pool 2 with P1 compute resources, if desired.
trans-unit.target: That means you can have Worker Pool 1 with P4 compute resources and Worker Pool 2 with P1 compute resources, if desired.

trans-unit.source: They do not have to be in size order.
trans-unit.target: They do not have to be in size order.

trans-unit.source: For details around the sizes and their pricing see the document here <linkText>Azure App Service Pricing[appservicepricing]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For details around the sizes and their pricing see the document here <linkText>Azure App Service Pricing[appservicepricing]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This leaves the scaling options for web apps and App Service Plans in an App Service Environment to be:
trans-unit.target: This leaves the scaling options for web apps and App Service Plans in an App Service Environment to be:

trans-unit.source: worker pool selection
trans-unit.target: worker pool selection

trans-unit.source: number of instances
trans-unit.target: number of instances

trans-unit.source: Changing either item is done through the appropriate UI shown with your App Service Plan.
trans-unit.target: Changing either item is done through the appropriate UI shown with your App Service Plan.

trans-unit.source: When you first create your web app in an App Service Environment you should scale it up to at least 2 instances to provide fault tolerance.
trans-unit.target: When you first create your web app in an App Service Environment you should scale it up to at least 2 instances to provide fault tolerance.

trans-unit.source: If your ASE has enough capacity then this is pretty simple.
trans-unit.target: If your ASE has enough capacity then this is pretty simple.

trans-unit.source: You go to your App Service Plan that holds the sites you want to scale up and select Scale.
trans-unit.target: You go to your App Service Plan that holds the sites you want to scale up and select Scale.

trans-unit.source: This opens the UI where you simply slide the instance indicator up to the desired value and save.
trans-unit.target: This opens the UI where you simply slide the instance indicator up to the desired value and save.

trans-unit.source: You won't be able to scale up your App Service Plan beyond the number of available compute resources in the worker pool that your App Service Plan is in.
trans-unit.target: You won't be able to scale up your App Service Plan beyond the number of available compute resources in the worker pool that your App Service Plan is in.

trans-unit.source: If you need more you need to get your ASE administrator to add more compute resources to the worker pool that you need them in.
trans-unit.target: If you need more you need to get your ASE administrator to add more compute resources to the worker pool that you need them in.

trans-unit.source: For information around re-configuring your ASE read the information here: <linkText>How to Configure an App Service environment[howtoconfigurease]</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For information around re-configuring your ASE read the information here: <linkText>How to Configure an App Service environment[howtoconfigurease]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The worker pool selection is accessed from the App Service Plan UI.
trans-unit.target: The worker pool selection is accessed from the App Service Plan UI.

trans-unit.source: Open the App Service Plan that you want to scale and select worker pool.
trans-unit.target: Open the App Service Plan that you want to scale and select worker pool.

trans-unit.source: You will see all of the worker pools which you have configured in your App Service Environment.
trans-unit.target: You will see all of the worker pools which you have configured in your App Service Environment.

trans-unit.source: If you have only one worker pool then you will only see the one pool listed.
trans-unit.target: If you have only one worker pool then you will only see the one pool listed.

trans-unit.source: To change what worker pool your App Service Plan is in, you simply select the worker pool you want your App Service Plan to move to.
trans-unit.target: To change what worker pool your App Service Plan is in, you simply select the worker pool you want your App Service Plan to move to.

trans-unit.source: Before doing this it is important to make sure you will have adequate capacity for your App Service Plan.
trans-unit.target: Before doing this it is important to make sure you will have adequate capacity for your App Service Plan.

trans-unit.source: In the list of worker pools, not only is the worker pool name listed but you can also see how many workers are available in that worker pool.
trans-unit.target: In the list of worker pools, not only is the worker pool name listed but you can also see how many workers are available in that worker pool.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that there are enough instances available to contain your App Service Plan.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that there are enough instances available to contain your App Service Plan.

trans-unit.source: If you need more compute resources in the worker pool you wish to move to, then get your ASE administrator to add them.
trans-unit.target: If you need more compute resources in the worker pool you wish to move to, then get your ASE administrator to add them.

trans-unit.source: Moving a web app from one worker pool will cause a restart of your web apps.
trans-unit.target: Moving a web app from one worker pool will cause a restart of your web apps.

trans-unit.source: This can cause a small amount of downtime for your app depending on how long it takes to restart.
trans-unit.target: This can cause a small amount of downtime for your app depending on how long it takes to restart.

trans-unit.source: To get started with App Service Environments, see <linkText>How To Create An App Service Environment[howtocreatease]</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: To get started with App Service Environments, see <linkText>How To Create An App Service Environment[howtocreatease]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: For more information about the Azure App Service platform, see <linkText>Azure App Service[azureappservice]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the Azure App Service platform, see <linkText>Azure App Service[azureappservice]</linkText><title></title>.
